article_title: What would Martin Luther King Jr. think of the America of 2016?
article_text:
Activists, historians, politicians and others offer answers

What would cheer him: African-American president, activists still fighting for equality

What would disappoint: The poverty, the violence, and persistent biases against minorities

article_metadata.news-keywords: MLK, race, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Malcolm Graham, Tim Funk
article_metadata.description: It’s been nearly 50 years since Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was murdered in Memphis at age 39.
article_metadata.title: What would Martin Luther King Jr. think of the America of 2016? | The Charlotte Observer
